query:
INSERT INTO articles (title, slug, excerpt, content, featuredImage, status, authorId, publishedAt)
VALUES (
  'Albania Tourism Sees Record Growth in 2026',
  'albania-tourism-sees-record-growth-in-2026',
  'The Albanian tourism sector has reported unprecedented growth this year, with visitor numbers increasing by 35% compared to 2025, driven by new coastal developments and international recognition.',
  'Albania''s tourism industry is experiencing a remarkable transformation in 2026, with the country emerging as one of Europe''s fastest-growing travel destinations. According to the latest data from the Ministry of Tourism and Environment, international visitor arrivals have surged by 35% compared to the same period last year, marking a historic milestone for the nation.

The Albanian Riviera, stretching along the Ionian Sea, has become the centerpiece of this tourism boom. New luxury resorts and boutique hotels have opened in popular destinations like Ksamil, Dhërmi, and Himara, offering world-class amenities while preserving the region''s natural beauty and cultural heritage.

"We are witnessing an unprecedented interest in Albania as a premium travel destination," said Minister of Tourism Mirela Kumbaro. "Our strategic investments in infrastructure, combined with our rich cultural heritage and stunning natural landscapes, are attracting discerning travelers from across Europe and beyond."

The growth is not limited to coastal areas. Tirana, the capital city, has seen a 40% increase in urban tourism, with visitors drawn to its vibrant arts scene, innovative restaurants, and historical landmarks. The city''s transformation from a post-communist capital to a dynamic European hub has captured international attention.

Mountain tourism is also flourishing, with the Albanian Alps attracting adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts. The Valbona Valley and Theth National Park have become popular destinations for hiking, with new eco-lodges and sustainable tourism initiatives supporting local communities.

Economic impact has been substantial. The tourism sector now contributes approximately 8.5% to Albania''s GDP, up from 6.2% in 2023. Employment in tourism-related industries has grown by 25%, creating thousands of new jobs for young Albanians and helping to reverse the brain drain that has affected the country for decades.

International recognition has played a crucial role in this success. Albania was recently featured in major travel publications as a "must-visit destination," and several Albanian beaches received Blue Flag certifications for their environmental standards and water quality.

Looking ahead, the government has announced plans to invest €500 million in tourism infrastructure over the next three years, focusing on sustainable development, cultural preservation, and improving accessibility to remote areas. New direct flight routes from major European cities are also being established, making Albania more accessible than ever.

Industry experts predict that if current trends continue, Albania could welcome over 10 million international visitors annually by 2028, cementing its position as a major Mediterranean tourism destination.',
  'https://files.manuscdn.com/user_upload_by_module/session_file/310419663030573139/zOvePviDeDaxNQMa.jpg',
  'published',
  1,
  NOW()
);

INSERT INTO article_categories (articleId, categoryId)
SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID(), id FROM categories WHERE slug = 'economy';
command:

  'https://files.manuscdn.com/user_upload_by_module/session_file/310419663030573139/zOvePviDeDaxNQMa.jpg',
